ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.2_0: At that time the nun Thullanandā stood and talked alone with men on streets, in cul-de-sacs, and at intersections, and she whispered in their ears and dismissed her companion nun.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.3_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.4_0: “How can Venerable Thullanandā do such things?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.8_0: “... How can the nun Thullanandā do such things?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.10_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.11.1_0: ‘If a nun stands or talks alone with a man, talks alone with menstruations, or talks alone with a man intersection, and she wounds her companions or open, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.8_0: one departs the same way one enters.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.12_0: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of having lust.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.16_0: just the man and the nun.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.17_0: if she stands or talks outside;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.18_0: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.20_0: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.22_0: if she tells a person to tell them of the person, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.24_0: If he does not want to misbehave like this, but he sends her away on the second day, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.25_0: If the companion nun is in the process of going beyond the range of sight or the range of hearing, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.26_0: When the other monk has gone beyond, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.1_0: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.2_0: If she stands or talks with a male spirit, a male ghost, a _paṇḍaka_, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.4_0: if he has a companion who understands;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.5_0: if she is not seeking privacy;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.6_0: if she stands or talks thinking of something else;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.8_0: if she sends her away when there is something to be done;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.10_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.11_0: The fourth training rule is finished.
